step_feedback.feedback: For step 1, focus on making a tight fist and drawing your arms in front of your chest. Ensure you are inhaling and tightening your muscles as instructed.
In step 2, remember to open your fingers and extend your arms horizontally to shoulder height while exhaling and relaxing your muscles. Try to keep your arms level.
For step 3, continue to open your fingers and extend your arms horizontally to shoulder height. Focus on exhaling and relaxing your muscles fully.
In step 4, maintain the open fingers and horizontal arm extension. Ensure you are exhaling and relaxing your muscles as you move your arms outwards.
For step 5, continue to open your fingers and extend your arms horizontally to shoulder height. Remember to exhale and relax your muscles completely.

exercise_summary: You did a good job with the horizontal pumping exercise! Remember to make a tight fist and inhale when bringing your arms in, then open your fingers and exhale as you extend them out. Keep practicing this for better lymph drainage.
